SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.form

Class Form

java.lang.Object
ca.jolt.form.Form
public final class Form extends Object
A container for form fields, field values, and their associated validators.

This class orchestrates the validation process—both synchronous and asynchronous—by delegating to each field's FieldValidator.

Key responsibilities:

  • Store raw field values in a map.
  • Maintain a map of field names to FieldValidator instances.
  • Perform synchronous validation via verify(String[]).
  • Perform asynchronous validation (supporting
    invalid reference 
    AsyncRule
    ) via
    invalid reference 
    #verifyAsync(String[])
    .
  • Track validation errors in a dedicated map.

Usage Example: 



 Form form = new Form(); // You can also do: ctx.buildForm();
 form.setValue("username", "john_doe");

 form.field("username")
         .required("Username is required")
         .minLength(3, "Username must be at least 3 characters long.");

 if (form.verify()) {
     // All validations passed!
 } else {
     // Handle errors
     Map<String, String> errors = form.getErrors();
 }
Since:
1.0
Author:
William
See Also:

      Constructs a new, empty Form (no initial data).

  • Method Details

    • field

      public FieldValidator field(String fieldName)
      Retrieves (or creates) a FieldValidator for the specified field name.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field to be validated
      Returns:
      The associated FieldValidator

    • setValue

      public Form setValue(String fieldName, String value)
      Sets (or updates) the value for the specified field in this form.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      value - The field value as a string
      Returns:
      This Form object (for fluent chaining)

    • verify

      public boolean verify(String... excludedFields)
      Verifies all fields in this form, except those specified in the excludedFields array.

      Any fields whose names are included in excludedFields will be skipped and assumed valid. The method logs the verification results and, if validation passes and a success callback is registered, it executes the callback.

      Parameters:
      excludedFields - Field names to skip during validation
      Returns:
      true if all non-excluded fields pass validation; false otherwise

    • getErrors

      public Map<String,String> getErrors()
      Returns a map of the first error for each field produced during the last validation call. This method is for backwards compatibility with code expecting only one error per field.
      Returns:
      A map from field names to their first error message

    • getError

      public String getError(String fieldName)
      Returns the first error message for the given field, or null if no error is present.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field
      Returns:
      The first error message, or null if no error exists

    • getAllErrors

      public Map<String,List<String>> getAllErrors()
      Returns a map containing all error messages for all fields that failed validation. Each field can have multiple errors if multiple validation rules failed.
      Returns:
      A map from field names to lists of error messages

    • addError

      public void addError(String fieldName, String errorMessage)
      Adds an error for the given field. This method stores both the first error for backward compatibility and adds to the complete list of all errors.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field that failed validation
      errorMessage - The error message describing why validation failed

    • getValue

      public String getValue(String fieldName)
      Retrieves the raw (string) value for the given field name.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      Returns:
      The string value, or null if not set

    • getValueAsInt

      public Integer getValueAsInt(String fieldName)
      Retrieves and parses the value of a field as an Integer.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      Returns:
      The parsed integer
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If the value is missing or not parseable as an int

    • getValueAsDouble

      public Double getValueAsDouble(String fieldName)
      Retrieves and parses the value of a field as a Double.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      Returns:
      The parsed double
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If the value is missing or not parseable as a double

    • getValueAsBoolean

      public Boolean getValueAsBoolean(String fieldName)
      Retrieves and parses the value of a field as a Boolean.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      Returns:
      The parsed boolean
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If the value is missing (null or empty)

    • getValueAsDate

      public LocalDate getValueAsDate(String fieldName)
      Retrieves and parses the value of a field as a LocalDate, using either a custom date pattern (if registered) or "yyyy-MM-dd" by default.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      Returns:
      The parsed date
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If the value is missing or cannot be parsed

    • getValueAsDate

      public LocalDate getValueAsDate(String fieldName, String pattern)
      Retrieves and parses the value of a field as a LocalDate, using the specified date pattern rather than any pattern in datePatterns.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The field name
      pattern - The date pattern (e.g., "MM/dd/yyyy")
      Returns:
      The parsed date
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If the value is missing or cannot be parsed

    • buildEntity

      public <T> T buildEntity(Class<T> clazz, String... ignoreFields)
      Attempts to build an instance of the specified class from the form data. It converts the form's field values map into a JSON string and then deserializes that JSON into the target entity.

      Fields specified in ignoreFields are omitted from the conversion.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the class
      Parameters:
      clazz - The class to instantiate
      ignoreFields - Field names to exclude from conversion
      Returns:
      An instance of T populated with the form's field values
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If conversion fails

    • updateEntity

      public <T> T updateEntity(T entity, String... ignoreFields)
      Updates the provided entity instance with values from the form's field values, ignoring any fields specified in the ignoreFields array.

      This method creates a copy of the form's field values, removes any entries whose keys are present in the ignoreFields, and then uses Jackson's

      invalid reference 
      ObjectMapper#updateValue(Object, Object)
      to update the entity with the remaining values. Any form fields that do not correspond to properties in the entity are ignored.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the entity.
      Parameters:
      entity - The existing entity instance to be updated.
      ignoreFields - Field names to exclude from updating.
      Returns:
      The updated entity instance.
      Throws:
      FormConversionException - If an error occurs during the update process.

    • setErrorTemplate

      public Form setErrorTemplate(String template)
      Changes how errors are displayed in getAllErrors(), by allowing a custom template string with {field} and {message} placeholders.
      Parameters:
      template - The template for formatting error strings
      Returns:
      This Form (for fluent chaining)

    • onSuccess

      public Form onSuccess(Runnable callback)
      Specifies a callback to run if the form validation succeeds.
      Parameters:
      callback - A Runnable to execute upon successful validation
      Returns:
      This Form (for fluent chaining)

    • validateField

      public static FieldValidator validateField(String fieldName, String value)
      Creates a quick, single-field Form and returns a FieldValidator for it, useful for one-off validations.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field being validated
      value - The initial value for that field
      Returns:
      A new FieldValidator for chaining additional rules
